meanings.definition: A bundle of grain stalks tied together after reaping.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered a sheaf of wheat from the field.
meanings.sent2: The sheaf of barley was heavy to carry.
meanings.sent3: The sheaf of corn told the funniest jokes in the barn.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a sheaf of joy in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The golden sheaf swayed gently in the breeze, a picture of harvest time.

meanings.definition: A bundle of papers or documents held together.
meanings.sent1: She placed the sheaf of letters on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The sheaf of legal documents needed to be signed.
meanings.sent3: The sheaf of recipes spilled out of the drawer, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were a sheaf of papers scattered by the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sheaf of old newspapers was ready for recycling.

meanings.definition: A group or collection of things.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a sheaf of ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The sheaf of books on the shelf caught her eye.
meanings.sent3: The sheaf of toys in the playroom seemed to come alive at night.
meanings.sent4: Their memories formed a sheaf of moments to cherish forever.
meanings.sent5: The sheaf of colorful balloons floated high in the sky, a cheerful sight.
